title: org.parkerici-candel-1.3.1-import-config
description: A JSON schema generated by Unify, intended for use in validating yaml import config files dynamically in editors for this particular schema and version.

uid.description: Synthetic unique ID for clinical trial

name-short.description: A short name for this clinical trial

name-long.description: The full name of this clinical trial

other-ids.description: Alternative identifiers for this clinical trial

nct-number.description: The NCT number of the clinical trial. Must be unique within the database

uid.description: Synthetic unique ID for clinical trial

name-short.description: A short name for this clinical trial

name-long.description: The full name of this clinical trial

other-ids.description: Alternative identifiers for this clinical trial

nct-number.description: The NCT number of the clinical trial. Must be unique within the database

name.description: The name of the nanostring signature

gene-weights.description:
The list of genes that are used to calculate this nanostring signature, together
                          with their score

name.description: The name of the nanostring signature

gene-weights.description:
The list of genes that are used to calculate this nanostring signature, together
                          with their score

exac-af-adj.description: Adjusted global allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

exac-nfe.description: Non-Finnish European allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

feature-type.description: The type of feature (transcript, regulatory, motif), refers to idents in the 'variant.feature.type' namespace

HGVSc.description: The HGVSc string for this variant, see http://varnomen.hgvs.org/

HGVSp.description: The HGVSp strings for this variant, see http://varnomen.hgvs.org/

exac-afr.description: African/African-American allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

exac-sas.description: South Asian allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

ref-allele.description: The reference allele for this variant

id.description:
Globally unique id for this variant. This is constructed by joining using '/' the
                          coordinates, ref-allele and alt-allele

publication.description: DOI of publication associated with this variant, as a string

exac-af.description: Global allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

coordinate-string.description: The coordinate string (summarized genomic coordinate info) for this variant.

context.description: The reference allele per VCF specs, and its five flanking base pairs

exac-oth.description: Other allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

impact.description: The impact modifier for this variant. Refers to entities in the variant.impact namespace

dbSNP.description: A list of dbSNP (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/SNP/) ids for this variant

exac-fin.description: Finnish allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

ref-amino-acid.description: The reference one letter coded amino acid sequence for this variant (ie A, R)

type.description: The type of this variant, refers to idents in the 'variant.type' namespace

exac-amr.description: American allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

exac-eas.description: East Asian allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

so-consequences.description:
The functional consequence of the variant, in sequence ontology terms (http://www.sequenceontology.org/).
                          Refers to so-sequence-feature entities

alt-amino-acid.description: The alternate one letter coded amino acid sequence for this variant (ie A, R)

alt-allele-2.description: The 2nd alternate allele for this variant

neo-antigens.description: The list of neo-antigens associated with this variant

alt-allele.description: The alternate allele for this variant

classification.description: The classification of this variant, refers to idents in the 'variant.classification' namespace

exac-af-adj.description: Adjusted global allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

exac-nfe.description: Non-Finnish European allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

feature-type.description: The type of feature (transcript, regulatory, motif), refers to idents in the 'variant.feature.type' namespace

HGVSc.description: The HGVSc string for this variant, see http://varnomen.hgvs.org/

HGVSp.description: The HGVSp strings for this variant, see http://varnomen.hgvs.org/

exac-afr.description: African/African-American allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

exac-sas.description: South Asian allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

ref-allele.description: The reference allele for this variant

id.description:
Globally unique id for this variant. This is constructed by joining using '/' the
                          coordinates, ref-allele and alt-allele

publication.description: DOI of publication associated with this variant, as a string

exac-af.description: Global allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

coordinate-string.description: The coordinate string (summarized genomic coordinate info) for this variant.

context.description: The reference allele per VCF specs, and its five flanking base pairs

exac-oth.description: Other allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

impact.description: The impact modifier for this variant. Refers to entities in the variant.impact namespace

dbSNP.description: A list of dbSNP (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/SNP/) ids for this variant

exac-fin.description: Finnish allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

ref-amino-acid.description: The reference one letter coded amino acid sequence for this variant (ie A, R)

type.description: The type of this variant, refers to idents in the 'variant.type' namespace

exac-amr.description: American allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

exac-eas.description: East Asian allele frequency from ExAC, in range [0, 1]. See http://exac.broadinstitute.org/

so-consequences.description:
The functional consequence of the variant, in sequence ontology terms (http://www.sequenceontology.org/).
                          Refers to so-sequence-feature entities

alt-amino-acid.description: The alternate one letter coded amino acid sequence for this variant (ie A, R)

alt-allele-2.description: The 2nd alternate allele for this variant

neo-antigens.description: The list of neo-antigens associated with this variant

alt-allele.description: The alternate allele for this variant

classification.description: The classification of this variant, refers to idents in the 'variant.classification' namespace

id.description: The id of this genomic coordinate as a string 'assembly:contig:strand:start:end'. Must be unique within the database

assembly.description: The reference genomic assembly for this coordinate, refers to idents in the 'assembly' namespace

start.description: The start position for this coordinate as an integer

contig.description: The genomic contig (e.g. the chromosome) for this coordinate as a string

strand.description: The strand for this coordinate, either '+' or '-'

end.description: The end position for this coordinate as an integer

id.description: The id of this genomic coordinate as a string 'assembly:contig:strand:start:end'. Must be unique within the database

assembly.description: The reference genomic assembly for this coordinate, refers to idents in the 'assembly' namespace

start.description: The start position for this coordinate as an integer

contig.description: The genomic contig (e.g. the chromosome) for this coordinate as a string

strand.description: The strand for this coordinate, either '+' or '-'

end.description: The end position for this coordinate as an integer

id.description: ID of the coordinates of the CNV segment. Identical to genomic coordinate ID.

genes.description: The list of genes included in this CNV segment

genomic-coordinates.description: The coordinates of this Copy Number Variation (CNV) segment

id.description: ID of the coordinates of the CNV segment. Identical to genomic coordinate ID.

genes.description: The list of genes included in this CNV segment

genomic-coordinates.description: The coordinates of this Copy Number Variation (CNV) segment

id.description:
The id of the epitope. This is unique within the database.
                           The id is a string constructed by joining using '/' the following fields:
                           1) the protein uniprot ID
                           2) the modifications, in alphabetical order

protein.description: The protein of which this is an epitope. May be more than one, e.g. in the case of heterodimers.

id.description:
The id of the epitope. This is unique within the database.
                           The id is a string constructed by joining using '/' the following fields:
                           1) the protein uniprot ID
                           2) the modifications, in alphabetical order

protein.description: The protein of which this is an epitope. May be more than one, e.g. in the case of heterodimers.

user.description: The email address of the user who created this import.

mappings.description: Relative path of the mappings.edn file that specifies enum renaming.

treatment-regimens.description: The list of treatment regimens for this dataset

setting.description: The setting (e.g. adjuvant) of this treatment regimen. Refers to idents in the 'treatment.setting namespace'

name.description:
The name of the treatment regimen. Must be unique within this dataset but not
                          necessarily within the database

drug-regimens.description: The drug regimens that constitute this treatment regimen

drug.description: The drug used in this regimen

id.description: The id of the drug regimen

uid.description: Synthetic unique ID for this drug regimen

freetext-drug.description: The drug used in this regimen in free text form

cycle-length.description: Length of the drug cycle (in days)

trial-arm.description: The arm of the clinical trial that this treatment regimen is part of (if any)

clinical-trial.description: The clinical trial that this treatment regimen is part of (if any)

study-days.description: The list of study days for this dataset

id.description: The id of the study day

uid.description: Synthetic unique ID for study days

reference-event.description:
The reference event (e.g. study enrollment) that study days are counted from. Refers
                          to entities in the study.day.reference.event namespace

day.description: The days since the reference event

doi.description: The digital object identifier (DOI) of the dataset

clinical-observation-sets.description: The list of clinical observation sets for this dataset

clinical-observations.description: The list of clinicial observations for this clinical-observation-set

ttf.description: The time to treatment failure of the subject in months. Such observations should be connected to the End of Study (EOS) timepoint

rano.description: RANO (Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology) assessment for brain tumor patients (MRI-based)

bmi.description:
The body mass index of the subject. Unless more information is available,
                          such observations should be connected to the baseline timepoint

os.description: The overall survival of the subject in months. Such observations should be connected to the End of Study (EOS) timepoint.

ca19-9.description: CA19-9 (Cancer Antigen 19-9) measurement from blood, in U/mL

timepoint.description: The timepoint at which this observation was performed

id.description: The id of the clinical observation. Must be unique within this dataset (but not within the entire database)

pfs-event.description: If PFS observation is censored (use false as the value) or connected to an event (use true)

uid.description: Synthetic unique ID for clinical observation

bor.description: The best overall response (RECIST) of the subject. Such observations should be connected to the End of Study (EOS) timepoint

pfs.description: The progression free survival of the subject in months. Such observations should be connected to the End of Study (EOS) timepoint

dfi-event.description: If DFI observation is censored (use false as the value) or connected to an event (use true)

disease-stage.description:
The stage of the disease. Refers to entities in the 'disease.stage' namespace. This is a clinical-observation
                          in order to allow the possibility for re-staging (even though technically tumor stage is not a time-varying
                          concept)

tumor-sum-diam.description: The sum of the tumor diameters in mm

study-day.description: The study-day at which this observation was performed

recurrence.description: Indicates that the disease has recurred

subject.description: The subject that this clinical observation was performed in

os-reason.description:
The reason (e.g. progression, censoring etc.) supplied for clinical observation OS.
                          Refers to entities in the :clinical-observation.event-reason namespace.
                          See https://candel.parkerici.org/schema/#representing-data-for-survival-analysis-eg-pfs-os-etc for more information
                          about modeling survival data

ldh.description: Lactate Dehydrogenase (LDH) measurement in blood, expressed in U/L

metastasis-gdc-anatomic-sites.description: The GDC anatomic site(s) at which metastasis have been observed

absolute-leukocyte-count.description: The absolute leukocyte count expressed in number of cells per microliter

ttf-event.description: If TTF observation is censored (use false as the value) or connected to an event (use true)

ir-recist.description:
The irRECIST (Immune Related Response Evaluation Critera in Solid Tumors) score for this observation,
                          refers to idents in the 'ir.recist' namespace

dcb.description: Whether this patient has experienced Durable Clinical Benefit. Such observations should be connected to the End of Study (EOS) timepoint

ctc.description: CTC (Ciculating Tumor Cells) measurement from blood, in CTC/7.5 mL whole blood

dfi.description:
The length of time (in months) the length of time after primary treatment for a cancer ends
                          that the patient survives without any signs or symptoms of that cancer. Such observations should
                          be connected to the End of Study (EOS) timepoint

dfi-reason.description:
The reason (e.g. progression, censoring etc.) supplied for clinical observation DFI.
                          Refers to entities in the :clinical-observation.event-reason namespace.
                          See https://candel.parkerici.org/schema/#representing-data-for-survival-analysis-eg-pfs-os-etc for more information
                          about modeling survival data

psa.description: PSA (Prostate-specific antigen) measurement from blood, in ng/mL

absolute-monocyte-count.description: The absolute monocyte count expressed in number of cells per microliter

os-event.description: If OS observation is censored (use false as the value) or connected to an event (use true)

tumor-sum-diam-perc-change.description: The percent change in the tumor sum of diameters. Must be a number in [-1 1]

recist.description:
The RECIST (Response Evaluation Critera in Solid Tumors) score for this observation,
                          refers to idents in the 'recist' namespace

metastatic.description: Indicates that the disease has become metastatic

pfs-reason.description:
The reason (e.g. progression, censoring etc.) supplied for clinical observation PFS.
                          Refers to entities in the :clinical-observation.event-reason namespace.
                          See https://candel.parkerici.org/schema/#representing-data-for-survival-analysis-eg-pfs-os-etc for more information
                          about modeling survival data

ttf-reason.description:
The reason (e.g. progression, censoring etc.) supplied for clinical observation TTF.
                          Refers to entities in the :clinical-observation.event-reason namespace.
                          See https://candel.parkerici.org/schema/#representing-data-for-survival-analysis-eg-pfs-os-etc for more information
                          about modeling survival data

adverse-events.description: The list of adverse events for this clinical-observation-set

ae-causality.description: Causality analysis for the AE. Refer to idents in the ae.causality namespace

verbatim-adverse-event.description: Adverse event in free text form, verbatim as reported by provider

timepoint.description: The timepoint at which this AE was observed

id.description: The id of the AE. Must be unique within this dataset (but not within the entire database)

uid.description: Synthetic unique ID for the AE

ctcae-grade.description: Grade of the adverse event. Refer to idents in the ae.grade namespace

ae-start-relative-day.description: Study-relative-day of the reported start of the AE

ae-duration.description: Duration of the AE in days

study-day.description: The study day on which this AE was observed

subject.description: The subject that this AE was observed in

meddra-adverse-event.description: Adverse event coded per MedDRA classification

name.description: The name of the dataset, must be unique and 256 character maximum

assays.description: The list of assays for this dataset

technology.description: The technology used for this assay. Refers to idents in the 'technology' namespace

measurement-sets.description: The list of measurement sets for this assay

cell-populations.description: The cell populations that are referenced by measurements in this measurement-set

parent.description:
The cell-population that is a parent of this cell-population. This is meant to
                          represent gating hierarchies

name.description: The name of this cell population, must be unique within the scope of this measurement-set

from-clustering.description:
Flag indicating whether this cell population was derived from automatic clustering
                          (i.e. as opposed to manual gating)

positive-markers.description:
Reference to markers (i.e. epitopes) whose presence contributes to defining
                          this cell population. This does not have to be an exhaustive list as it is meant
                          to represent concepts such as Ki67+ CD4 T cells

cell-type.description:
The cell-type represented by this cell-population. This is mandatory for populations
                          that have not been defined by clustering

terra-workspace.description: The Terra workspace associated with the pipeline that generated this measurement-set.

normalization-method.description:
Freetext description of the normalization method used for measurements contained in the measurement-set
                           (ie for gene expression measurements, normalization by housekeeping gene values)

analysis-docker.description: A link to the docker image for the container used to run the analysis

measurements.description: The measurement values for this measurement set

tcr-beta-clonality.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the clonality (range 0-1) of TCR alpha sequences a sample.
                           This measurement type is common when TCR sequences are computationally derived from RNAseq data
                           and thus alpha and beta pairing is not known.

nanostring-signature.description: The target nanostring signature for this measurement

baf-n.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the allelic fraction of the B allele in normal tissue, for a copy number variation segment

read-count-otu.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the count of reads for a specific OTU

percent-of-leukocytes.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the abundance of a specific cell-populations, expressed
                          as the percentage of the total number of leukocytes in the sample (mostly useful for flow cytometry assays

olink-npx.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents npx units (i.e. Normalized protein expression
                          from an Olink assay, https://www.olink.com/question/what-is-npx/)

percent-of-lymphocytes.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the abundance of a specific cell-populations, expressed
                          as the percentage of the total number of lymphocytes in the sample (mostly useful for flow cytometry assays

baf.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the allelic fraction of the B allele in tumor tissue, for a copy number variation segment

tcr-d.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the hits for possible D gene segment linking to a specific T Cell Receptor (TCR)

cell-count.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the number of cells in a specific cell-population

b-allele-cn.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the copy number of the B allele

pg-mL.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents a concentration expressed as pg/mL

tcr-clonality.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents a TCR clonality measurement. Note that in this case
                          the entity will not have a specific TCR target.

contamination.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the fraction of reads that do not come from this sample
                          (expressed as a number in [0, 1]). Note that in this case the measurement will not have any target

vaf.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the variant allele frequency of a variant

rsem-normalized-count.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the RSEM normalized count. This is a transformation where
                          for gene level estimates you divide all raw-count values by the 75th percentile of the column (after removing zeros) and multiply that by 1000. This
                          transforms each sample so that the values are relative the 75th percentile with a x1000 adjustment factor (see https://www.biostars.org/p/106127/).
                          Most papers that analyze TCGA data use log2(rsem-normalized-count + 1)

gene-product.description: The target gene product for this measurement

absolute-cn.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the absolute copy number of a segment

live-count.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the number of live cells in a sample (mostly useful for
                          flow cytometry assays. Note that in this case the measurement will not target any specific cell-population

image-intensity-median.description: Per-segment intensity (median) for a given epitope (marker channel)

nuclei-count.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the number of nuclei in a sample (mostly useful for
                          imaging assays. Note that in this case the measurement will not target any specific cell-population

t-alt-count.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the read depth supporting the variant allele in the tumor sequencing output

percent-of-live.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the abundance of a specific cell-populations, expressed
                          as the percentage of the total number of live cells in the sample (mostly useful for flow cytometry assays

tcr-count.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the counts of a specific T Cell Receptor (TCR)

cell-population.description: The target cell population for this measurement

tcr-j.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the hits for possible J gene segment linking to a specific T Cell Receptor (TCR)

tcr-alpha-clonality.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the clonality (range 0-1) of TCR alpha sequences a sample.
                           This measurement type is common when TCR sequences are computationally derived from RNAseq data
                           and thus alpha and beta pairing is not known.

id.description: The id of the measurement. Must be unique within this dataset (but not within the entire database)

rpkm.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents a RPKM value (Reads Per Kilobase Million, a measure
                          of gene expression in RNAseq experiments)

n-depth.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the read depth across this locus in the normal sequencing output

median-channel-value.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents a median channel (protein) value of a cytometry population or cluster

tcr-v.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the hits for possible V gene segment linking to a specific T Cell Receptor (TCR)

percent-of-singlets.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the abundance of a specific cell-populations, expressed
                          as the percentage of the total number of singlets in the sample (mostly useful for flow cytometry assays

n-alt-count.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the read depth supporting the variant allele in the normal sequencing output

array-log-intensity.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents a log intensity equivalent to a one channel gene expression array
                          (ie Affymetrix) -- log2 scaled intensity values.

total-reads.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the total number of reads in a sample.
                          Note that in this case the measurement will not have any target

protein-array-log-intensity.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents a log intensity equivalent to one channel protein expression array.

a-allele-cn.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the copy number of the A allele

tmb-total.description: Tumor mutational burden expressed as the total number of mutations (SNVs + indels) per Mb sequenced

tcr-frequency.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the frequency of a specific T Cell Receptor (TCR)

cfdna-ng-mL.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents a concentration of cell-free DNA (cfDNA) in blood, expressed as ng/mL

otu.description: The target OTU for this measurement

singlets-count.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the number of singlets in a sample (mostly useful for
                          flow cytometry assays. Note that in this case the measurement will not target any specific cell-population

tumor-purity.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the tumor purity of a sample
                          (expressed as a number in [0, 1]). Note that in this case the measurement will not have any target

rsem-scaled-estimate.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the RSEM scaled estimate, i.e. the fraction of transcripts
                          made up by a given gene (see https://www.biostars.org/p/106127/)

percent-of-parent.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the abundance of a specific cell-populations, expressed
                          as the percentage of its parent population

loh.description: Use this attribute if the measurement demonstrates a loss of heterozygosity (LOH) for a copy number variation segment

cnv.description: The target cnv for this measurement

msi-status.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the MSI (Microsatellite Instability) status of
                           the tumor as determined by either IHC or sequencing. This attribute refers to enums in the 
                           :measurement.msi-status namespace.

epitope.description: The target protein epitope for this measurement

tpm.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents a TPM value (Transcripts Per Kilobase Million, a measure
                          of gene expression in RNAseq experiments)

segment-mean-lrr.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the mean Log R Ratio (LRR) of a CNV (Copy Number Variation) segment. This is equal
                          to log2(copy-number / 2) for a genomic segment

percent-of-total-cells.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the abundance of a specific cell-populations, expressed
                          as the percentage of the total number of cells in the sample (in [0, 1], mostly useful for flow cytometry assays)

array-log-ratio.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the log ratio of a two channel gene expression array
                          usually expressed as log2(sample/reference) with sample as the Cy5 (red) channel and reference as the Cy3 (green) channel)

kallisto-abundance.description:
The kallisto estimated abundance (pseudoalignment method). Abundances should sum to 1e6.
                          See https://pachterlab.github.io/kallisto/about for more information.

percent-of-nuclei.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the abundance of a specific cell-populations, expressed
                          as the percentage of the total number of nucleated cells (mostly useful for imaging assays)

image-intensity-mean.description: Per-segment intensity (mean) for a given epitope (marker channel)

live-percent.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the percentage of live cells in a sample.
                          Note that in tihs case the measurement will not have a target cell population

average-depth.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the average sequencing depth of a sample.
                          Note that in this case the measurement will not have any target

fpkm.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents a FPKM value (Fragments Per Kilobase Million, a measure
                          of gene expression in RNAseq experiments)

image-intensity-sum.description: Per-segment intensity (sum) for a given epitope (marker channel)

tmb-snv.description: Tumor mutational burden expressed as the total number of SNVs per Mb sequenced

atac-peak.description: The target ATAC peak for this measurement

leukocyte-count.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the number of leukocytes in a sample (mostly useful for
                          flow cytometry assays. Note that in this case the measurement will not target any specific cell-population

nanostring-signature-score.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the score for a nanostring signature

tcr.description: The target T Cell Receptor (TCR) for this measurement

fraction-reads-in-peaks.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the fraction of reads that are assigned to a peak in a sample
                          (relevant for ATACesq data and expressed as a number in [0, 1]). Note that in this case the measurement will not have any target

fraction-aligned-reads.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the fraction of aligned reads in a sample
                          (expressed as a number in [0, 1]). Note that in this case the measurement will not have any target

nuclei-per-mm2.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the number of nuclei per mm2 of tissue, as measured by
                           an imaging assay (ie IHC, Vectra, CODEX, etc.). This measurement type can be paired with a cell-population
                           target (:measurement/cell-population) or used alone to denote the total cell density. Note that this attribute
                           should only be used if a nuclei-only segmentation method was used to segment the image.

n-ref-count.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the read depth supporting the reference allele in the normal sequencing output

cnv-call.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the CNV overall gain (gain, loss, or neutral)
                           for a genetic region (cnv). This attribute refers to enums in the :measurement.cnv-call namespace.

rsem-raw-count.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the RSEM raw count, i.e. the estimated number of fragments
                          derived from a given gene (see https://www.biostars.org/p/106127/)

nanostring-count.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents a gene expression count from Nanostring

tmb-indel.description: Tumor mutational burden expressed as the total number of indels per Mb sequenced

read-count.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the count of reads for a specific target

U-L.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents a concentration expressed as units (U) /L

ng-mL.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents a concentration expressed as ng/mL

t-depth.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the read depth across this locus in the tumor sequencing output

read-count-otu-rarefied.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the rarefied count of reads for a specific OTU

luminex-mfi.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents MFI (Mean Fluorescence Intensity) for a Luminex Multiplex Immunoassay.

lymphocyte-count.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the number of lymphocytes in a sample (mostly useful for
                          flow cytometry assays. Note that in this case the measurement will not target any specific cell-population

t-ref-count.description: Use this attribute if the measurement represents the read depth supporting the reference allele in the tumor sequencing output

variant.description: The target variant for this measurement

tss-score.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the TSS score of the sample (relevant for ATACseq data).
                          Note that in this case the measurement will not have any target

sample.description: The biological sample this measurement was performed on

cells-per-mm2.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents the number of cells per mm2 of tissue, as measured by
                           an imaging assay (ie IHC, Vectra, CODEX, etc.). This measurement type can be paired with a cell-population
                           target (:measurement/cell-population) or used alone to denote the total cell density. Note that this attribute
                           should only be used if a whole-cell segmentation method was used to segment the image.

chromvar-tf-binding-score.description:
Use this attribute if the measurement represents a transcription factor binding score
                          as calculated by chromVAR

region-of-interest.description: For imaging data, the region of interest that this measurement refers to

single-cells.description: The single cells that are referenced by measurements in this measurement-set

cell-populations.description: Any cell populations to which this cell has been assigned membership, e.g. via clustering.

pixel-image-offset-x.description: X coordinate in pixel offset (upper left coordinates) for segment centroid

id.description: The id for a given single cell. Must be uniquely identifying, so often a concatenation, e.g. sample-barcode.

uid.description: Synthetic unique ID for single cells.

pixel-image-offset-y.description: Y coordinate in pixel offset (upper left coordinates) for segment centroid

normalized-image-coordinate-x.description: X coordinate in normalized image coordinate scheme for segment centroid

normalized-image-coordinate-y.description: Y coordinate in normalized image coordinate scheme for segment centroid

sample.description: The sample from which this single cell was sourced.

otus.description: The OTU's that are referenced by measurements in this measurement-set

genus.description: The taxonomic genus for this OTU

species.description: The taxonomic species for this OTU

class.description: The taxonomic class for this OTU

id.description: The id of the OTU

phylum.description: The taxonomic phylum for this OTU

order.description: The taxonomic order for this OTU

family.description: The taxonomic family for this OTU

kingdom.description: The taxonomic kingdom for this OTU

tcrs.description: The TCRs that are referenced by measurements in this measurement-set

alpha-1.description: The sequence, in amino acid terms, of the first TCR alpha chain, if present

id.description:
The ID of the TCR, formed as a string by combining the tcr-alpha-1, tcr-alpha-2, and tcr-beta
                          separated by /, prefer nucleotide sequence if present, but if not available fall back to AA seq.

uid.description: The UID (context aware) ID for this TCR.

alpha-2.description: The sequence, in amino acid terms, of the second TCR alpha chain, if present

beta.description: The sequence, in amino acid terms, of the TCR beta chain, if present

terra-namespace.description: The Terra namespace associated with the pipeline that generated this measurement-set.

terra-submission-id.description: The id of the Terra submission associated with the pipeline that generated this measurement-set

name.description: The name of the measurement set (e.g. 'baseline'). Must be unique within the scope of the parent assay

analysis-repository.description: git remote of the repository containing the analysis code that generated this measurement-set

atac-peaks.description: The ATAC peaks that are referenced by measurements in this measurement-set

jointly-called.description: Whether this peak was derived by jointly calling on multiple samples

quality-score.description: The quality score for the peak. This is calculated as int(-10*log10qvalue)

name.description: The name of the ATAC peak. Must be unique within the scope of the measurement-set

genomic-coordinates.description: The genomic coordinates of the ATAC peak

summit-offset.description: The offset of the peak summit from the beginning of the region

fixed-width.description:
Whether this peak was called in fixed width mode, i.e. all of the peaks are the same width,
                          and have the summit of the peak as their center

-log10pvalue.description: -log10 of the p-value for local Poisson test at peak

-log10qvalue.description: Similar to -log10pvalue, but after Benjamini-Hochberg correction

measurement-matrices.description: The measurement values for this measurement set as matrix blobs (dense or sparse)

cell-populations.description: The set of all cell populations referenced in this measurement matrix file.

single-cells.description: The set of all single cells referenced in this measurement matrix file.

measurement-type.description: The measurement attribute which matches the type of values stored in this measurement matrix file.

gene-products.description: The set of all gene products referenced in this measurement matrix file.

name.description: The unique name identifying this measurement matrix within the measurement set scope.

backing-file.description: Generated by unify: the s3 key where the matrix tsv file will be uploaded.

epitopes.description: The set of all epitopes referenced in this measurement matrix file.

samples.description: The set of all samples referenced in this measurement matrix file.

terra-workflow.description: The Terra worfklow associated with the pipeline that generated this measurement-set.

cellengine-experiment-revision-id.description: The id of the specific revision of the CellEngine experiment that generated this measurement-set

image-scale-um-per-pixel-x.description: X-dimension scale factor for imaging data in um per pixel

image-scale-um-per-pixel-y.description: Y-dimension scale factor for imaging data in um per pixel

description.description:
A description for this measurement-set. A measurement set groups together measurements that are related. It can
                          be used to indicate concepts such as:
                            1) Measurements that were performed as part of a separate experimental condition
                            2) Measurements that are derived from a separate computational analysis, e.g. a separate clustering run
                               os a separate run of a variant calling pipeline

name.description: The name of the assay, must be unique within the dataset, but not within the entire database

description.description: A free text description for this assay

subjects.description: The list of subjects for this dataset

ethnicity.description: The ethnicity of the subject, refers to idents in the 'ethnicity' namespace

age.description: The age of the subject in years

race.description: The race of the subject, refers to idents in the 'race' namespace

HLA-A-type.description: The HLA-A type of the subject, as a string

meddra-disease.description: The disease (i.e. cancer type) of this subject according to the MedDRA classification

HLA-C-type.description: The HLA-C type of the subject, as a string

id.description: The id of the subject. Must be unique within this dataset (but not within the entire database)

HLA-DR-type.description: The HLA-DR type of the subject, as a string

therapies.description:
The list of therapies for this subject. Note that every subject must have a value for this attribute
                          even when all the subjects in the dataset received the same therapy (or therapies)

cohort.description:
This attribute can be used to assign a subject to an arbitrary cohort for this therapy
                          (e.g. Phase 1 vs Phase 2). Note that this is just an arbitrary string that is not checked
                          for consistency and does not represent a formal grouping in a parent entity

id.description: The id of the therapy. Must be unique within this dataset (but not within the entire database)

uid.description: Synthetic unique ID for the therapy

treatment-regimen.description: The treatment regimen that corresponds to this therapy

previous.description: Previous types of therapy for this patient. Refers to entities in the therapy.previous namespace

line.description: The line of therapy for this subject (e.g. first line, second line etc.) as an integer

order.description: The order of this therapy in this subject's treatment history

dlt-evaluable.description: Whether the subject is part of the DLT-evaluable population for this therapy

safety-evaluable.description: Whether the subject is part of the safety-evaluable population for this therapy

HLA-B-type.description: The HLA-B type of the subject, as a string

freetext-disease.description: The disease (i.e. cancer type) of this subject in free text form

cause-of-death.description: The cause of death for the subject. Refers to idents in the subject.cause.of.death namespace

smoker.description: The smoking status of the subject. Refers to idents in the 'smoker' namespace

sex.description: The sex of the subject. Refers to idents in the 'sex' namespace

menopause.description: Whether the subject has undergone menopause or not

HLA-DQ-type.description: The HLA-DQ type of the subject, as a string

HLA-DP-type.description: The HLA-DP type of the subject, as a string

dead.description: Whether the subject is dead or not

timepoints.description: The list of timepoints for this dataset

offset.description:
The offset in number of days (positive or negative) between this specific timepoint and the nominal timepoint
                          indicate by its :timepoint/attribute. For instance to indicate two timepoints that are 5 days before and after
                          the first treatment, you would create two timepoint entities both with type :timepoint/treatment1 and with offsets
                          -5 and +5 respectively

cycle.description: If applicable, the cycle of therapy that this timepoint represents

id.description:
The id of the timepoint. This is unique within the dataset, but not necessarily within the database. If this timepoint
                          is associated with a treatment regimen, the id must to start with the treatment regimen followed by the
                          character '/'. The rest of the id is free format

treatment-regimen.description:
The treatment regimen that this timepoint is part of. Note that timepoints that have a :timepoint/relative-order
                          attribute MUST refer to a treatment regimens. Timepoints that do not have such attribute may exist outside
                          of any treatment-regimen

relative-order.description:
The relative order of this timepoint within its treatment regimen. This field is mandatory for
                          timepoints that have a :timepoint/treatment-regimen attribute

type.description:
The type of this timepoint, refers to idents in the 'timepoint' namespace. The type of the timepoint is meant to
                          represent both logical timepoints that exist outside of any chronological timeline (e.g. 'baseline'), as well
                          as nominal timepoints within a treatment regimen (e.g. 'treatment1'). This field is mandatory

day.description: If applicable, the day in the cycle of therapy that this timepoint represents

description.description: A short, free text description of the dataset

samples.description: The list of samples for this dataset

tissue-acquisition-method.description: The method by which this tissue sample was acquired. This attribute refers to enums in the :sample.tissue-acquisition-method namespace.

freetext-anatomic-site.description: The anatomical location from which this sample was collected in free text form

timepoint.description: The timepoint when this sample was collected

id.description: The id of the sample. Must be unique within a dataset, but not necessarily within the database

metastasis.description: Whether this is a sample from a metastasis

laterality.description:
For tumors in paired organs, designates the side on which the specimen was obtained. This attribute
                          was derived from GDC and refers to entities in the 'sample.laterality' namespace

study-day.description: The study day when this sample was collected

recurrence.description: Whether this is a sample from a recurrence

subject.description: The subject that this sample was derived from

specimen.description: The specimen type for this sample, refers to idents in the 'sample.specimen' namespace

gdc-anatomic-site.description: The anatomical location from which this sample was collected according to the Genomics Data Commons (GDC) vocabulary

type.description: The type of this sample (tumor / normal), refers to idents in the 'sample.type' namespace

container.description:
The container that was initially used to collect this sample (if known), e.g. CPT tube, EDTA tube etc.
                          Refers to idents in the 'sample.container' namespace

tumor-type.description: The tumor type. This is presently a string, but needs to be moved to an enum

wt-peptide.description: The wildtype peptide for this neo-antigen

mut-peptide.description: The mutated peptide for this neo-antigen

wt-score.description: The score associated with the wildtype peptide

mut-score.description: The score associated with the mutated peptide

wt-peptide.description: The wildtype peptide for this neo-antigen

mut-peptide.description: The mutated peptide for this neo-antigen

wt-score.description: The score associated with the wildtype peptide

mut-score.description: The score associated with the mutated peptide
